Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide (FSAP) family. Brevinin subfamily.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.9022710] Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium BM11 (LC=2.8 µM), Staphylococcus aureus Cowanl (LC=6.0 µM), Streptococcus pyogenes betahemolytic group A (LC=7.0 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D21(LC=21.0 µM), Escherichia coli D21e7 (LC=13.2 µM), Escherichia coli D21f1 (LC=10.0 µM), Escherichia coli D21f2 (LC=3.3 µM), Escherichia coli D22 (LC=11.2 µM),Yersinia pseudotuberculosis (LC=7.0 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC15692 (LC>360 µM);Yeast:Candida albicans (LC=4.0 µM).(LC:Lethal concentration).[Ref.28443279] Gram-positive bacterium:S.aureus ATCC 33591 (MIC=12μM), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=6μM);Gram-negative bacterium:Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC BAA-1706 (MIC=48μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=48μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.9022710] LC>120 µM against Human red blood cells. (LC:Lethal concentration)[Ref.28443279] 1% hemolysis at 96μM against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive, Gram-negative bacteria and fungi. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Temporins, antimicrobial peptides from the European red frog Rana temporaria.
Literature.Author: Simmaco M, Mignogna G, Canofeni S, Miele R, Mangoni ML, Barra D.

Literature.Title: Analogs of the Frog-skin Antimicrobial Peptide Temporin 1Tb Exhibit a Wider Spectrum of Activity and a Stronger Antibiofilm Potential as Compared to the Parental Peptide
Literature.Author: Grassi L, Maisetta G, Maccari G, Esin S, Batoni G.
